verses.verse: Tremble before Him, all the earth. The world also is firmly established, It shall not be moved.
Let the heavens rejoice, and let the earth be glad; And let them say among the nations, “The LORD reigns.”
Let the sea roar, and all its fullness; Let the field rejoice, and all that is in it.
Then the (Is. 55:12, 13) trees of the woods shall rejoice before the LORD, For He is ((Joel 3:1-14); Zech. 14:1-14; (Matt. 25:31-46)) coming to judge the earth.
(2 Chr. 5:13; 7:3; Ezra 3:11; Ps. 106:1; 107:1; 118:1; 136:1; Jer. 33:11) Oh, give thanks to the LORD, for He is good! For His mercy endures forever.
(Ps. 106:47, 48) And say, “Save us, O God of our salvation; Gather us together, and deliver us from the Gentiles, To give thanks to Your holy name, To triumph in Your praise.”
(1 Kin. 8:15, 56; Ps. 72:18) Blessed be the LORD God of Israel From everlasting to everlasting! And all (Deut. 27:15; Neh. 8:6) the people said, “Amen!” and praised the LORD.

(Regular Worship Maintained) So he left (1 Chr. 16:4, 5) Asaph and his brothers there before the ark of the covenant of the LORD to minister before the ark regularly, as every day’s work (2 Chr. 8:14; Ezra 3:4) required;
and (1 Chr. 13:14) Obed-Edom with his sixty-eight brethren, including Obed-Edom the son of Jeduthun, and Hosah, to be gatekeepers;
and Zadok the priest and his brethren the priests, (1 Chr. 21:29; 2 Chr. 1:3) before the tabernacle of the LORD (1 Kin. 3:4) at the high place that was at Gibeon,

to offer burnt offerings to the LORD on the altar of burnt offering regularly ((Ex. 29:38-42; Num. 28:3, 4)) morning and evening, and to do according to all that is written in the Law of the LORD which He commanded Israel;

and with them Heman and Jeduthun and the rest who were chosen, who were designated by name, to give thanks to the LORD, (1 Chr. 25:1-6; 2 Chr. 5:13; 7:3; Ezra 3:11; Jer. 33:11) because His mercy endures forever;
and with them Heman and Jeduthun, to sound aloud with trumpets and cymbals and the musical instruments of God. Now the sons of Jeduthun were gatekeepers.
(2 Sam. 6:18-20) Then all the people departed, every man to his house; and David returned to bless his house.

(God’s Covenant with David) Now (2 Sam. 7:1; 1 Chr. 14:1) it came to pass, when David was dwelling in his house, that David said to Nathan the prophet, “See now, I dwell in a house of cedar, but the ark of the covenant of the LORD is under tent curtains.”
Then Nathan said to David, “Do all that is in your heart, for God is with you.”
But it happened that night that the word of God came to Nathan, saying,
“Go and tell My servant David, ‘Thus says the LORD: “You shall ((1 Chr. 28:2, 3)) not build Me a house to dwell in.
For I have not dwelt in a house since the time that I brought up Israel, even to this day, but have gone from tent to tent, and from one tabernacle to another.

Wherever I have moved about with all Israel, have I ever spoken a word to any of the judges of Israel, whom I commanded to shepherd My people, saying, ‘Why have you not built Me a house of cedar-’ ” ’
Now therefore, thus shall you say to My servant David, ‘Thus says the LORD of hosts: “I took you (1 Sam. 16:11-13) from the sheepfold, from following the sheep, to be ruler over My people Israel.
And I have been with you wherever you have gone, and have cut off all your enemies from before you, and have made you a name like the name of the great men who are on the earth.

Moreover I will appoint a place for My people Israel, and will ((Deut. 30:1-9; Jer. 16:14-16; 23:5-8; 24:6; Ezek. 37:21-27); Amos 9:14) plant them, that they may dwell in a place of their own and move no more; nor shall the sons of wickedness oppress them anymore, as previously,
since the time that I commanded judges to be over My people Israel. Also I will subdue all your enemies. Furthermore I tell you that the LORD will build you a house.

And it shall be, when your days are (1 Kin. 2:10; 1 Chr. 29:28) fulfilled, when you must go to be with your fathers, that I will set up your (1 Kin. 5:5; 6:12; 8:19-21; (1 Chr. 22:9-13; 28:20); Matt. 1:6; Luke 3:31) seed after you, who will be of your sons; and I will establish his kingdom.
(1 Kin. 6:38; 2 Chr. 6:2; (Ps. 89:20-37)) He shall build Me a house, and I will establish his throne forever.

(2 Sam. 7:14, 15; Matt. 3:17; Mark 1:11; Luke 3:22; 2 Cor. 6:18; Heb. 1:5) I will be his Father, and he shall be My son; and I will not take My mercy away from him, ((1 Sam. 15:23-28); 1 Chr. 10:14) as I took it from him who was before you.
